div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Unlawful Detention of Seventy-six Hindus.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA NORTHERN DIVISION WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON

ELLIS DEBRULER, being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: that he is Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, and that the attached bill in favor of J. Richard Lane, Esq., is a just bill for the board of the Hindus named therein from September 27, 1913 to the dates therein specificed and that the money now on deposit in the Registry of the Court for the payment of the board of the said Hindus should be applied on this said bill.
SUBSCRIBED and sworn to before me this 21 day of October, 1913.
John H. Sargent Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
